definition: to gorge oneself/to eat heartily (idiom)
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
rapid/quick/speed/rate/soon/almost/to make haste/clever/sharp (of knives or wits)/forthright/plainspoken/gratified/pleased/pleasant
flower/earlobe/fig. item on both sides/classifier for flowers, clouds etc
cheek/lower cheek/chin/jaw/to nourish

sentences.english: We all think eating fruit means just buying fruit, cutting it up and popping it into our mouths.
sentences.chinese: 一說喫水果，我們就想到買說過，切成塊，大快朵頤。

sentences.english: Others chow down on everything in sight and still stay skinny.
sentences.chinese: 其他人對眼前的任何食物都大快朵頤，可還是很瘦。

sentences.english: He sweated as he watched us gobble down the food.
sentences.chinese: 當他看着我們大快朵頤時都冒汗了。

sentences.english: Serve steamed fish, he carved out shark fin, meet to watch her cheek.
sentences.chinese: 蒸魚上桌後，他又剔掉魚刺，滿足地看着她大快朵頤。

sentences.english: But don’t use this as an open invitation to pig out.
sentences.chinese: 但不要把這種方法用成放開胃口大快朵頤了。

sentences.english: Have no meat unhappy ready to visit over time?
sentences.chinese: 向來無肉不歡的準備好大快朵頤一番了嗎？

sentences.english: The Japanese auto industry was preparing to have Detroit for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 日本的汽車工業準備將底特律大快朵頤。

definition: to eat and eat/to stuff oneself
to be full (after eating)
to satisfy one's craving
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
to eat one's fill/to be full
to taste a small amount/to sample
gluttonous/ravenous
stomach rumbling with hunger
striving to be first and fearing to be last (idiom); outdoing one another
leaving a rich aftertaste/(fig.) memorable/lingering in memory
to eat one's fill/to have a good meal
free-range chicken
variant of 熱乎乎|热乎乎[re4 hu1 hu1]
to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
to go hungry/to endure starvation/famished
nice and warm
